translation.IDevelop: I develop user interfaces and web applications
translation.aboutP1: Hi there! My name is Samuel Piasecki, and I'm a frontend developer based in Brazil. I graduated with a degree in computer science and have been passionate about programming ever since. With a strong focus on web development, I have gained extensive knowledge and experience working with various JavaScript frameworks and libraries.
translation.aboutP2: Over the years, I have honed my skills in creating engaging and user-friendly web interfaces. From responsive designs to interactive components, I strive to deliver seamless experiences for users across different devices. I am well-versed in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and I keep up with the latest industry trends and best practices to ensure the highest quality of my work.
translation.aboutP3: I am thrilled to continue my journey as a frontend developer, constantly learning and expanding my skills to create innovative and impactful digital experiences.
translation.whatIHaveDone: What I have done so far
translation.internshipPoint1: Developing and maintaining web applications using HTML, SASS, PHP and other related technologies.
translation.internshipPoint2: Collaborating with cross-functional teams including designers, and other developers.
translation.internshipPoint3: Implementing responsive design and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
translation.developerPoint1: Developing and maintaining web applications using HTML, SASS, PHP and other related technologies.
translation.developerPoint2: Collaborating with cross-functional teams including designers, and other developers.
translation.developerPoint3: Implementing responsive design and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
translation.inThisSection: In this section, I want to show you some of the projects that I developed focusing on learning and improving my skills.
translation.notionaryDescription: This Project was created to develop more advanced skills with Vue.js. The following tools were used in Notionary: Vue.js, Firebase, Bulma, Vue-router, Pinia and Compositions APIs.
translation.apoloDescription: The objective of this project is to learn how to build React applications and develop skills to work with front-end. In this project, you will see a landing page to organize characters/items in their roles. You can organize them into: Enemies; Characters; Items; Scenarios; Extras.
translation.agnoliniDescription: Welcome to the Angolini Restaurant Menu project! This project is a web application built with React, TypeScript, ESLint, SCSS, and React Router DOM. It aims to showcase a menu for a restaurant that specializes in serving delicious pastas.
translation.talesOfTaleDescription: This mobile game was created as my Final Paper for my graduation. I created this project with a friend, and I created all the interfaces of the game. This includes: UX, sprites, and soundtrack.
translation.studyClockDescription: Study Clock is a simple application built with React and TypeScript that helps you manage your study sessions. With Study Clock, you can set a timer for a specific amount of time.
translation.timelineDescription: Project with Next.js developed during a course in Alura, where the idea was to develop a 'Blog' about my progress in my careear. In this project was used: Next.js, React, Typescript, CSS-in-Js, Context API, amoung others techs.
translation.name: Your Name
